intro: Siphocampylus tuerckheimii, commonly known as the Tuerckheim's siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it often grows in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
